result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob D Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob D Walker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob D Walker was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

$67 VW surcharge paid in full with bond.  DA & DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.

records.addlTxt: of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

4:00 PM Defendant Jacob D Walker in court.  Attorney Tracey J Lencioni in court for Jacob D Walker.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 2.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 1  . 

 Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #      2
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 6 months in the DCJ, with Huber 

-Stayed for 2 years probation

CONDITIONS:

-No threats/acts of violence against: KK
-DOC DV treatment
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #2
-DA surcharge
- All CC, DA surcharge DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved/due on probation

-Bond posted to be applied to fines and cc only and remainder returned to poster.

-Days credit if revoked: 0

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 19, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

7:29 AM Prosecuting attorney Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Jacob D Walker not in court, in custody.  Attorney Tracey J Lencioni in court for Jacob D Walker. Defn requests plea/sentencing.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's
Pre-trial conference on August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with KAK. 
- Defendant shall not be in the 700 block of Nygaard St in Stoughton. 
Trial Judge - Br 12

01:56 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Diana Maria Van Rybroek.  Thersa Louise Lewandowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim via Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 10:00 am.
